summary: This is a court order from Judge Richard M. Berman scheduling a hearing on August 27, 2019, regarding the proposed dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein following his death. The order states that the government, Epstein's counsel, victims, and their counsel will be heard at the hearing to address the public's informational interest in the dismissal process.

events.title: Hearing on Dismissal of Indictment
events.description: A court hearing scheduled to address the proposed dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein following his death. The government, Epstein's counsel, victims, and their counsel will be heard.

events.title: Proposal to Dismiss Indictment
events.description: The United States Attorney proposed an order to the court seeking dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT SOUTHERN DISTRICT OF NEW YORK
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died before any judgment was entered against him in his criminal case.
The United States Attorney proposed dismissing the indictment on August 19, 2019.
Judge Richard M. Berman scheduled a hearing for August 27, 2019, to allow the government, Epstein's counsel, victims, and victims' counsel to be heard regarding the dismissal.
The judge cited the public's informational interest in the process of dismissing an indictment after a defendant's death as a reason for the hearing.
The hearing was to be held in Courtroom 17B.
